pages.text: Whenever a Vagrant is crouching, the behavior of the Latch changes slightly. If the Latch were to be retracted while affixed to another parasite, the parasite will be stored in the Vagrant's internal structure. It is unknown exactly how this is doner Pure versions, but the widely accepted interpretation is that the method is akin to that of a Dispatcher.

Storage is still beholden to the $(l:vagrant/bloom)Corpse Bloom$() system, that being a Vagrant's Tier needs to be equivalent to or greater than the instance being stored, and testing has indicated that only one instance can be stored at a time. The stored parasite is ejected whenever the Latch is deployed again while the Vagrant is crouching.

There also appears to be a select few species that Vagrants cannot store, such as Stage IV Nexus versions. Their ability to relocate such parasites at lower stages is extremely dangerous, and is yet another reason why Vagrants should be destroyed on sight. Containing them for the sake of gathering information will only waste more time.
